meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.longTitle: An Ordinance to provide for the establishment of the Electronic Health Record Sharing System, the sharing and using of data and information contained in the System, and the protection of the System, data and information; and to provide for incidental and related matters.

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Electronic Health Record Sharing System Ordinance.
This Ordinance comes into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Health by notice published in the Gazette. (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: Commissioner (專員) means the public officer appointed under section 48 to be the Commissioner for the Electronic Health Record;
company (公司) means a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
consent (同意), in relation to an individual, means an express consent of the individual;
data access request (查閱資料要求) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Privacy Ordinance;
data correction request (改正資料要求) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Privacy Ordinance;
data sharing (資料互通) means the act of providing or obtaining any sharable data of a registered healthcare recipient through the System;

electronic health record (電子健康紀錄)—(a)in relation to a registered healthcare recipient, means the record for the recipient that is kept under section 5(2); and(b)in relation to a healthcare recipient who was once registered, but is no longer registered, means the record for the recipient that was kept under section 5(2);

electronic medical record system (電子醫療紀錄系統), in relation to a healthcare provider, means an information system used by the healthcare provider to keep the medical record of a healthcare recipient electronically for the recipient’s healthcare purpose;
family member (家人), in relation to a healthcare recipient, means an individual who is related to the recipient by blood, marriage, adoption or affinity;

healthcare (醫護服務), in relation to an individual, means an activity performed by a healthcare professional for the individual for—(a)assessing, recording, maintaining or improving the individual’s health;(b)diagnosing the individual’s illness or disability; or(c)treating the individual’s illness or disability, or suspected illness or disability;
healthcare professional (醫護專業人員) means a person specified in the Schedule;
healthcare provider (醫護提供者) means a person that provides healthcare;
healthcare recipient (醫護接受者) means an individual for whom healthcare has been performed, is performed, or is likely to be performed in Hong Kong;

healthcare referral (醫護服務轉介), in relation to a registered healthcare recipient, means a recommendation made by a prescribed healthcare provider for the provision of healthcare to the recipient by another prescribed healthcare provider;
identifiable data (可識辨身分資料)—see subsection (2)(a);
identity card (身分證) has the meaning given by section 1A(1) of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177);
joining consent (參與同意) means a consent given under section 7(1) or (2);
minor (幼年人) means a person below 16 years of age;
non-identifiable data (非可識辨身分資料)—see subsection (2)(b);

parent (家長), in relation to a child, means—(a)the natural father or natural mother of the child (whether or not the natural father and natural mother are married to each other);(b)a parent of the child by adoption under, or recognized as valid by, law; or(c)a stepfather or stepmother of the child;
prescribed healthcare provider (訂明醫護提供者) means—(a)the Department of Health;(b)the Hospital Authority; or(c)a registered healthcare provider;
Privacy Commissioner (私隱專員) means the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data established under section 5(1) of the Privacy Ordinance;
Privacy Ordinance (《私隱條例》) means the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);

registration (登記)—(a)in relation to a healthcare recipient, means the registration of the healthcare recipient as a registered healthcare recipient under section 8(1);(b)in relation to a healthcare provider, means the registration of the healthcare provider as a healthcare provider for the System under section 20(1) for a service location;(c)in relation to a Government department, means the registration of the department as a healthcare provider for the System under section 22(1),and registered (登記) is to be construed accordingly;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Health; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
sharable data (可互通資料), in relation to a registered healthcare recipient, means both of the following—(a)the index data of the healthcare recipient;(b)the health data of the healthcare recipient;
sharing consent (互通同意) means a consent given under section 12(1);
sharing restriction request (互通限制要求) means a request made under section 17(1)(a);
substitute decision maker (代決人)—see section 3;
use (使用、用), in relation to data or information contained in an electronic health record, includes disclose or transfer the data or information.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any data or information of a healthcare recipient is identifiable data if the identity of the healthcare recipient is ascertainable from the data or information; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any data or information of a healthcare recipient is non-identifiable data if the identity of the healthcare recipient is unascertainable from the data or information.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to a form specified by the Commissioner is a reference to a form so specified under section 53.
For the purposes of this Ordinance, a person is a substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient if the person is an eligible person under subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: For a healthcare recipient who is a minor, the following are eligible persons for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a parent of the healthcare recipient who accompanies the healthcare recipient at the relevant time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a guardian of the healthcare recipient appointed under or acting by virtue of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13), or otherwise appointed by the court, who accompanies the healthcare recipient at the relevant time;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: in the absence of the persons mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b) and (c), a family member of the healthcare recipient, or a person residing with the healthcare recipient, who accompanies the healthcare recipient at the relevant time;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in the absence of the persons mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d), the prescribed healthcare provider that provides, or is about to provide, healthcare to the healthcare recipient at the relevant time.

subsection.leadIn: For a healthcare recipient who is aged 16 or above and who is of any of the following descriptions, the persons specified in subsection (4) are eligible persons for the purposes of subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: being mentally incapacitated as defined by section 2(1) of the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being incapable of managing his or her own affairs;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: being incapable of giving a sharing consent at the time referred to in paragraph (d), (e) or (f) of the definition of relevant time in subsection (5);

content.i: being incapable of making a sharing restriction request at the time referred to in paragraph (g) or (h) of the definition of relevant time in subsection (5).

subsection.leadIn: The following are persons specified for the purposes of subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the healthcare recipient is placed under the guardianship of the Director of Social Welfare or any other person under section 44A(1)(i) of that Ordinance, the Director of Social Welfare or that other person;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: if the functions of guardian of the healthcare recipient are to be performed by the Director of Social Welfare or any other person under section 44B(2B) or 59T(2) of that Ordinance, the Director of Social Welfare or that other person;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: in the absence of the persons mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d) and (e), a family member of the healthcare recipient, or a person residing with the healthcare recipient, who accompanies the healthcare recipient at the relevant time;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in the absence of the persons mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f), the prescribed healthcare provider that provides, or is about to provide, healthcare to the healthcare recipient at the relevant time.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant time (有關時間) means—(a)in relation to an application that is made under section 6(1) for the healthcare recipient to be registered as a registered healthcare recipient, the time at which the application is made;(b)in relation to a joining consent that is required under section 7(1) or (2) for such an application, the time at which the joining consent is required;(c)in relation to a healthcare recipient’s registration that is withdrawn from the System by the operation of section 9, the time at which the request for withdrawal is made;(d)in relation to a sharing consent that is given under section 12(1), the time at which the sharing consent is given;(e)in relation to a sharing consent that is renewed under section 14(2), the time at which the sharing consent is renewed;(f)in relation to a sharing consent that is revoked under section 15(1), the time at which the revocation of the sharing consent is made;#(g)in relation to a sharing restriction request that is made under section 17(1)(a), the time at which the request is made;#(h)in relation to a request to remove a restriction that is made under section 17(1)(b), the time at which the request is made.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Ordinance applies to Government
section.content: This Ordinance applies to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must establish and maintain an information infrastructure with the name “Electronic Health Record Sharing System” in English and “電子健康紀錄互通系統” in Chinese for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keeping the records required by subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sharing and using data and information contained in those records.

subsection.leadIn: The System must keep a record of every registered healthcare recipient containing the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the index data of the recipient;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the health data of the recipient provided to the Commissioner in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other data or information of the recipient that is, in the Commissioner’s opinion, necessary for the proper functioning of the System.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application by healthcare recipients for registration

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a healthcare recipient to which this section applies, or a substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient, may apply to the Commissioner for the healthcare recipient to be registered as a registered healthcare recipient.

If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the application must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of giving a joining consent.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of giving a joining consent, the application must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
An application made by a substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient is made on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In making an application, a substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the information specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a joining consent.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a healthcare recipient—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who holds an identity card; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: who does not hold an identity card but holds—

subparagraph.content: any other identification document specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.content: For an application made by a healthcare recipient under section 6(1), the recipient must give a consent specified in subsection (3).

For an application made by a substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient under section 6(1), the substitute decision maker must give a consent specified in subsection (3) on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.

subsection.leadIn: The consent is for the Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to obtain from, and to provide to, a prescribed healthcare provider to which the healthcare recipient has given a sharing consent any sharable data of the recipient; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the prescribed healthcare provider has made a healthcare referral to another prescribed healthcare provider, to obtain from, and to provide to, that other prescribed healthcare provider any sharable data of the recipient relevant to the healthcare referral,

subsection.continued: for the operation of the System after the registration of the recipient.

subsection.content: A joining consent must be given in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A joining consent is revoked if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is withdrawn from the System by the operation of section 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is cancelled under section 11(1).

section.name: s8
section.heading: Registration of healthcare recipients by Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application made under section 6(1), the Commissioner, if satisfied that, on the face of it, the application complies with section 6(6), may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the healthcare recipient as a registered healthcare recipient; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose the conditions that the Commissioner considers appropriate for registering the healthcare recipient.

subsection.content: However, the Commissioner must not register the healthcare recipient if the Commissioner is satisfied that doing so may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.leadIn: After approving or refusing an application, the Commissioner must notify the healthcare recipient in writing of the decision and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is approved—the date on which the registration takes effect and the conditions for the registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a registered healthcare recipient, or a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient, may request that the registration of the recipient be withdrawn from the System.

If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the request must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of making the request.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of giving a joining consent, the request must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
A request made by a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient is made on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In making a request, a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.
A request must be made to the Commissioner in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.
After granting a request, the Commissioner must notify the requestor in writing of the date on which the request is granted. The withdrawal takes effect on that date.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may suspend the registration of a healthcare recipient for a period of not more than 28 days if the Commissioner reasonably suspects that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application for registration did not comply with section 6(6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient holds none of the documents specified in section 6(7);

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance; or
a condition for the registration; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), if the Commissioner considers it appropriate, the Commissioner may extend the period of suspension under that subsection for a further period of not more than 28 days by notice in writing to the specified person.

subsection.leadIn: After suspending the registration, the Commissioner must notify the specified person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the suspension;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the suspension takes effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reasons for the suspension.

subsection.leadIn: When the registration of a healthcare recipient is suspended—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: new data or information of the recipient may still be provided by a prescribed healthcare provider to the System; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the electronic health record of the recipient is not to be made available to a prescribed healthcare provider through the System.

subsection.leadIn: After the Commissioner is satisfied that there are no longer any grounds for suspending the healthcare recipient’s registration, the Commissioner must notify the specified person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the suspension ceases to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)if the healthcare recipient is a minor and the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration was made by a substitute decision maker, that substitute decision maker; (b)if the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is, in the Commissioner’s opinion, incapable of giving a joining consent and the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration was made by a substitute decision maker, that substitute decision maker; or(c)in any other case—(i)the healthcare recipient; or(ii)the substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient who made the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may cancel the registration of a healthcare recipient if the Commissioner is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the application for registration did not comply with section 6(6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient holds none of the documents specified in section 6(7);

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance; or
a condition for the registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the registration may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient has died.

subsection.leadIn: Except for a cancellation under subsection (1)(e), the Commissioner must notify the specified person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the cancellation.

subsection.content: The specified person may, within 14 days after the date of the notice (or such longer period as the Commissioner may allow), make representations to the Commissioner to object to the cancellation in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must not cancel the registration unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified person has not made any representations under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has considered the representations and informed the specified person of the decision of cancellation.

subsection.content: A cancellation under subsection (1)(e) takes effect on the date on which the Commissioner is satisfied that the healthcare recipient has died.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)if the healthcare recipient is a minor and the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration was made by a substitute decision maker, that substitute decision maker;(b)if the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is, in the Commissioner’s opinion, incapable of giving a joining consent and the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration was made by a substitute decision maker, that substitute decision maker; or(c)in any other case—(i)the healthcare recipient; or(ii)the substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient who made the application for the healthcare recipient’s registration.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a registered healthcare recipient, or a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient, may give a consent specified in subsection (6) to a prescribed healthcare provider that provides healthcare to the healthcare recipient.

If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the sharing consent must be given by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of giving the sharing consent.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of giving a sharing consent, the sharing consent must be given by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
A sharing consent given by a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient is given on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In giving a sharing consent, a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: The consent is for—

subparagraph.content: to provide to the System any sharable data of the healthcare recipient in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner;
to obtain from the System any sharable data of the healthcare recipient in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and
to provide to a referral healthcare provider any sharable data of the healthcare recipient relevant to the healthcare referral and in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and
to provide to the System any sharable data of the healthcare recipient relevant to the healthcare referral and in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and
to obtain from the System any sharable data of the healthcare recipient relevant to the healthcare referral and in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.content: A sharing consent must be given in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.
A sharing consent may be given for an indefinite term or a one-year term.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: referral healthcare provider (獲轉介醫護提供者) means a prescribed healthcare provider to which a healthcare referral of the healthcare recipient is made by the prescribed healthcare provider to which the consent is given.

subsection.content: This section applies to a sharing consent given for an indefinite term.

subsection.leadIn: The sharing consent is in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is withdrawn from the System by the operation of section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is cancelled under section 11(1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the consent is revoked under section 15(1).

subsection.content: This section applies to a sharing consent given for a one-year term.

Subject to subsections (3) and (4), as long as the sharing consent is in effect, the registered healthcare recipient, or a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient, may renew the sharing consent for another one-year term.

If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the sharing consent must be renewed by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of renewing the sharing consent.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of giving a sharing consent, the sharing consent must be renewed by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
A sharing consent renewed by a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient is renewed on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In renewing a sharing consent, a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.
If a sharing consent is renewed for a one-year term under subsection (2), that term is to commence on the date of the renewal.

subsection.leadIn: The sharing consent is in effect during its term until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is withdrawn from the System by the operation of section 9;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare recipient’s registration is cancelled under section 11(1); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the consent is revoked under section 15(1).

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), a registered healthcare recipient, or a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient, may revoke a sharing consent given to a prescribed healthcare provider.

If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the revocation must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of making the revocation.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of giving a sharing consent, the revocation must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
A revocation made by a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient is made on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In making a revocation, a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.
A revocation must be made in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.

After the revocation is recorded in the System, the Commissioner must notify the person making the revocation in writing of the date on which the record is made. The revocation takes effect on that date.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Sharing consent taken to be given

subsection.content: A healthcare recipient is taken to have given a sharing consent to the Department of Health and to the Hospital Authority when the healthcare recipient gives a joining consent.

A substitute decision maker of a healthcare recipient is taken to have given a sharing consent on behalf of and in the name of the recipient to the Department of Health and to the Hospital Authority when the substitute decision maker gives a joining consent.
A sharing consent taken to be given because of a joining consent is in effect as long as the joining consent is in effect.
Sections 12(7) and (8), 13, 14 and 15 do not apply to a sharing consent taken to be given under this section.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything contained in sections 12 and 16 and subject to subsections (2) and (3), a registered healthcare recipient, or a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient, may in relation to the health data of the healthcare recipient make—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a request to restrict the scope of data sharing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a request to remove a restriction on the scope of data sharing.

subsection.content: If the healthcare recipient is a minor, the request must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient unless the Commissioner is satisfied that the recipient is capable of making the request.
If the healthcare recipient is aged 16 or above and is incapable of making the request, the request must be made by a substitute decision maker of the healthcare recipient.
A request made by a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient is made on behalf of and in the name of the recipient.
In making a request, a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient must have regard to the best interests of the recipient in the circumstances.
A request must be made to the Commissioner in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.
The Commissioner must notify the requestor in writing of the date on which the requested restriction, or the requested removal of restriction, takes effect.
The Commissioner must specify the types of restriction in respect of which a person may make a request under section 17(1).
The Commissioner must make copies of a document setting out the specified types of restriction available to the public (in hard copy or electronic form).

division.name: D5
division.heading: Registration as Healthcare Providers for System

section.name: s19
section.heading: Application by healthcare providers for registration

subsection.content: A healthcare provider that provides healthcare at one service location in Hong Kong may apply to the Commissioner to be registered as a healthcare provider for the System for that location.

A healthcare provider that provides healthcare at more than one service location in Hong Kong may apply to the Commissioner to be registered as a healthcare provider for the System for those locations as provided in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), a healthcare provider may apply for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a single registration for all of the locations; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a separate registration for each location that the healthcare provider chooses to register.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by the information specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a healthcare provider provides healthcare at one service location if the healthcare provider—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is licensed under the Private Healthcare Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 633) in respect of one private healthcare facility; (Replaced 34 of 2018 s. 196 and E.R. 5 of 2018)

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: holds a licence issued under section 8(2)(a) of the Residential Care Homes (Elderly Persons) Ordinance (Cap. 459) in respect of one residential care home, and engages a healthcare professional to perform healthcare at that home; (Amended 12 of 2023 s. 117)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: holds a licence issued under section 7(2)(a), or a certificate of exemption issued under section 11(2)(a), of the Residential Care Homes (Persons with Disabilities) Ordinance (Cap. 613) in respect of one residential care home for persons with disabilities, and engages a healthcare professional to perform healthcare at that home; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: is a specified entity that engages a healthcare professional to perform healthcare at one premises.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (5)—
subsection.def: specified entity (指明實體) means—(a)an individual;(b)a company;(c)a partnership;(d)a statutory body;(e)a body corporate other than a company; or(f)a society, or a branch of a society, registered under section 5A(1), or exempted from registration under section 5A(2), of the Societies Ordinance (Cap. 151).

section.name: s20
section.heading: Registration of healthcare providers by Commissioner

subsection.leadIn: On receiving an application made under section 19(1) or (2), the Commissioner, if satisfied that the healthcare provider complies with the requirements set out in subsection (2), may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: register the healthcare provider as a healthcare provider for the System for the service location for which the application is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose the conditions that the Commissioner considers appropriate for registering the healthcare provider.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements specified by the Commissioner for connecting the healthcare provider to the System; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the system requirements on data sharing specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: However, the Commissioner must not register the healthcare provider if the Commissioner is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the service or business nature of the healthcare provider is not consistent with the purpose of the use of data and information specified in section 28; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: registering the healthcare provider may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.leadIn: After approving or refusing an application, the Commissioner must notify the healthcare provider in writing of the decision and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is approved—the date on which the registration takes effect and the conditions for the registration; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a healthcare provider registered under section 20(1) may request a registration be amended for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a change in the particulars of a service location; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a change of the service locations for which the healthcare provider is registered.

subsection.content: A healthcare provider must not request the registration be amended for a change of the service locations unless the healthcare provider would, after the change, still be registered for all of the service locations at which the healthcare provider provides healthcare in Hong Kong.
A request must be made to the Commissioner in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.
After granting a request, the Commissioner must notify the requestor in writing of the date on which the request is granted. The amendment takes effect on that date.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Registration of Government departments as healthcare providers

subsection.content: The Commissioner may register a Government department as a healthcare provider for the System if the Commissioner is satisfied that the department provides a healthcare professional to perform healthcare for any healthcare recipient.
The reference of a department in subsection (1) does not include the Department of Health.
A registered healthcare provider may request that a registration of the healthcare provider be withdrawn from the System.
A request must be made to the Commissioner in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner.
After granting a request, the Commissioner must notify the healthcare provider in writing of the date on which the request is granted. The withdrawal takes effect on that date.
If a sharing consent is given to the healthcare provider, the sharing consent ceases to have effect once the withdrawal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may suspend a registration of a registered healthcare provider for a period of not more than 28 days if the Commissioner reasonably suspects that—

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance;
a provision of a code of practice issued under section 52; or
a condition for the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare provider no longer provides healthcare at the service location to which the registration relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the healthcare provider no longer complies with—

subparagraph.content: the requirements specified by the Commissioner for connecting the healthcare provider to the System; or
the system requirements on data sharing specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the service or business nature of the healthcare provider is no longer consistent with the purpose of the use of data and information specified in section 28; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the registration may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.content: Despite subsection (1), if the Commissioner considers it appropriate, the Commissioner may extend the period of suspension under that subsection for a further period of not more than 28 days by notice in writing to the healthcare provider.

subsection.leadIn: After suspending a registration, the Commissioner must notify the healthcare provider in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the suspension;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the suspension takes effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reasons for the suspension.

subsection.leadIn: When the registration of a healthcare provider (including a Government department) is suspended—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: new data or information of a registered healthcare recipient may still be provided by the healthcare provider to the System; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the electronic health record of a registered healthcare recipient must not be made available to the healthcare provider through the System.

subsection.leadIn: After the Commissioner is satisfied that there are no longer any grounds for suspending the healthcare provider’s registration, the Commissioner must notify the healthcare provider in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Commissioner’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the suspension ceases to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may cancel a registration of a registered healthcare provider if the Commissioner is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance;
a provision of a code of practice issued under section 52; or
a condition for the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare provider no longer provides healthcare at the service location to which the registration relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the healthcare provider no longer complies with—

subparagraph.content: the requirements specified by the Commissioner for connecting the healthcare provider to the System; or
the system requirements on data sharing specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the service or business nature of the healthcare provider is no longer consistent with the purpose of the use of data and information specified in section 28; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the registration may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must notify the healthcare provider in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the cancellation.

subsection.content: The healthcare provider may, within 14 days after the date of the notice (or such longer period as the Commissioner may allow), make representations to the Commissioner to object to the cancellation in the manner specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner must not cancel the registration unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the healthcare provider has not made any representations under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner has considered the representations and informed the healthcare provider of the decision of cancellation.

subsection.content: If a sharing consent is given to the healthcare provider, the sharing consent ceases to have effect once the cancellation takes effect.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Supplementary provision to sections 24, 25 and 51
section.content: A reference in sections 24, 25 and 51 to the service location to which a registration relates includes each of the service locations covered by a single registration of a healthcare provider under section 19(3)(a).

section.name: s27
section.heading: General rule
section.content: The data and information contained in an electronic health record may not be used except as provided in section 28, 29, 30 or 31.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Use for improvement of healthcare
section.content: The data and information contained in the electronic health record of a registered healthcare recipient may be used for improving the efficiency, quality, continuity or integration of the healthcare provided, or to be provided, to the healthcare recipient.

subsection.content: The data and information contained in an electronic health record may be used for carrying out research, or preparing statistics, that are relevant to public health or public safety.
However, the results of the research or the resulting statistics must not be made available in a form that would enable a healthcare recipient to be identified.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Use for disease control and surveillance etc.

subsection.leadIn: The data and information contained in an electronic health record may be used by a person specified in subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the prevention or control of disease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the enhancement of disease surveillance or investigation.

subsection.leadIn: The person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Department of Health;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Hospital Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a health officer as defined by section 2 of the Prevention and Control of Disease Ordinance (Cap. 599).

section.name: s31
section.heading: Use permitted by or under any other law
section.content: The data and information contained in an electronic health record may be used as permitted by, or under, any other law.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Procedures for Use of Identifiable Data under Section 29

section.name: s32
section.heading: Application to Secretary for use for research or statistics purpose

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Secretary for using identifiable data of a healthcare recipient contained in an electronic health record for carrying out research, or preparing statistics, that are relevant to public health or public safety.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a proposal specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The proposal is a written proposal setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature and objectives in respect of the research or statistics;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the public or scientific benefit of the research or statistics that the applicant anticipates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other information relating to the research or statistics as specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.content: The Secretary may refer an application made under section 32(1) to the Board for a recommendation on whether the application should be approved or refused.

subsection.leadIn: When making a recommendation, the Board must have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether it is ethical to carry out the research or prepare the statistics;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the objectives in respect of the research or statistics are only achievable by using the identifiable data;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether it is practicable to obtain the consent of the healthcare recipient concerned for the use;

paragraph.name: d

subparagraph.content: the public interest in carrying out the research or preparing the statistics; and
the public interest in protecting the privacy of the healthcare recipient concerned; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the resource implication in providing the identifiable data.

subsection.content: If the Board recommends that the Secretary approves the application, the Board may also make recommendations on the conditions of the approval.

subsection.leadIn: After approving or refusing an application made under section 32(1), the Secretary must notify the applicant in writing of the decision and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is approved—the conditions of the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.content: If the application is approved, the identifiable data is to be made available to the applicant in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner after the applicant has paid the administrative costs for processing the application.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Procedures for Use of Non-identifiable Data under Section 29

section.name: s35
section.heading: Application to Commissioner for use for research or statistics purpose

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Commissioner for using non-identifiable data of a healthcare recipient contained in an electronic health record for carrying out research, or preparing statistics, that are relevant to public health or public safety.

subsection.leadIn: An application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be accompanied by a proposal specified in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The proposal is a written proposal setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nature and objectives in respect of the research or statistics;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the public or scientific benefit of the research or statistics that the applicant anticipates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other information relating to the research or statistics as specified by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: Before approving or refusing an application made under section 35(1), the Commissioner must have regard to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether it is ethical to carry out the research or prepare the statistics; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resource implication in providing the non-identifiable data.

subsection.leadIn: After approving or refusing an application made under section 35(1), the Commissioner must notify the applicant in writing of the decision and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is approved—the conditions of the approval; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.content: If the application is approved, the non-identifiable data is to be made available to the applicant in the form and manner specified by the Commissioner after the applicant has paid the administrative costs for processing the application.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Safeguards for Access to Electronic Health Record

section.name: s37
section.heading: Prescribed healthcare provider’s duties to restrict access to health data

subsection.content: This section applies if a prescribed healthcare provider is given a sharing consent by a registered healthcare recipient or a substitute decision maker of a registered healthcare recipient.

subsection.leadIn: The healthcare provider must take reasonable steps to ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: access to any health data of the healthcare recipient is restricted to a healthcare professional of the healthcare provider who may perform healthcare for the recipient; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the access is restricted to the health data that may be relevant for performing healthcare for the recipient.

subsection.content: However, for complying with a data access request or data correction request under Part 5 of the Privacy Ordinance, the healthcare provider is not to be treated as contravening the requirements under subsection (2) even if access to the health data is granted to a person other than the healthcare professional.

part.name: P4
part.heading: Application to Data or Information that is Personal Data under Privacy Ordinance

section.name: s38
section.heading: Data or information to which this Part applies
section.content: This Part applies to data or information that is personal data as defined by section 2(1) of the Privacy Ordinance.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Privacy Commissioner’s performance of functions or exercise of powers in relation to data or information

subsection.content: If the Privacy Commissioner performs a function or exercises a power under the Privacy Ordinance in relation to data or information contained in the System, the Privacy Commissioner must do so subject to the conditions specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a word or an expression used in this Part, and defined or otherwise explained in section 2 of the Privacy Ordinance, has the same meaning as in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: despite paragraph (a), a reference to a minor in the Privacy Ordinance is a reference to a person below 16 years of age.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(a) does not apply to the word “Commissioner”.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Commissioner’s further duty in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person is required to comply with section 23(1) of the Privacy Ordinance in relation to the data or information of a registered healthcare recipient that was provided to the System by the person as a prescribed healthcare provider; and

subparagraph.content: is no longer a prescribed healthcare provider;
no longer has the sharing consent of the healthcare recipient; or
fails to respond to a data correction request in compliance with the Privacy Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Commissioner must make a note, whether annexed to the data correction requested or elsewhere, of the matters in respect of which the data is considered by the requestor to be inaccurate.
The note must be made in such a way that the data cannot be used by a person without the note being drawn to the attention of, and being made available for inspection by, the person.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Contravention of requirement under Privacy Ordinance
section.content: For the purposes of the Privacy Ordinance, a contravention of a requirement under a provision of that Ordinance that has effect subject to this Part is to be regarded as a contravention of a requirement under that Ordinance.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Offences relating to accessing, damaging or modifying data or information

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person knowingly causes a computer to perform a function so as to obtain unauthorized access to data or information contained in an electronic health record.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), access by a person to data or information is unauthorized if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not entitled to control that access;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has not been authorized by another person who controls that access to obtain that access;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person does not believe that the authorization has been given; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person does not believe that, even if the person had applied to the appropriate authority, the authorization would have been given.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without lawful excuse, knowingly damages data or information contained in an electronic health record.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (4) is liable on summary conviction to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

subparagraph.content: causes access to data or information contained in an electronic health record;
causes modification of data or information contained in an electronic health record; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person causes the access, modification or impairment—

subparagraph.content: with intent to commit an offence;
with a dishonest intent to deceive;
with a view to dishonest gain for the person or for another; or
with a dishonest intent to cause loss to another,

paragraph.continued: whether on the same occasion as the person causes the access, modification or impairment or on any future occasion.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (6) is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for 5 years.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6)(b)—

subparagraph.content: a gain in money or other property;
a temporary gain or a permanent gain;
a gain by keeping what one has; and
a gain by getting what one has not; and
a loss in money or other property;
a temporary loss or a permanent loss;
a loss by not getting what one might get; and
a loss by parting with what one has.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: computer (電腦) means a device for storing, processing or retrieving data or information.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Offences relating to impairment to System

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person knowingly impairs the operation of the System.
A person who commits the offence is liable on conviction on indictment to imprisonment for 10 years.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Offences relating to data access requests and data correction requests

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to evade a data access request or data correction request in relation to any data or information contained in an electronic health record—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alters, falsifies, conceals or destroys the data or information; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: directs another person to do anything mentioned in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: A person who commits the offence is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.
A person commits an offence if the person knowingly makes an untrue statement to enable the person to give a joining consent or sharing consent.
A person who commits the offence is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Offences relating to contravening conditions for research or statistics purpose

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person knowingly contravenes a condition imposed under section 34(1)(a).
A person who commits the offence is liable on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.

A person commits an offence if the person uses another person’s data or information contained in an electronic health record, or a copy (in whatever format) of the data or information, for direct marketing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

A person commits an offence if, for gain, the person provides to others another person’s data or information contained in an electronic health record, or a copy (in whatever format) of the data or information, for direct marketing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years.

A person commits an offence if, not for gain, the person provides to others another person’s data or information contained in an electronic health record, or a copy (in whatever format) of the data or information, for direct marketing.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (5) is liable on conviction on indictment to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years.

This section does not apply in relation to the use or provision of data or information contained in an electronic health record, or a copy (in whatever format) of the data or information, by a person if, not for gain, the person uses or provides the data or information, or the copy, for a purpose specified in subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: The purpose is the offering, or the advertising of the availability, of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: social services run, subvented or subsidized by the Social Welfare Department;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: health care services provided or administered by the Department of Health or the Hospital Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: any other social or health care services that, if not provided, would be likely to cause serious harm to the physical or mental health of—

subparagraph.content: the individual to whom the services are intended to be provided; or
any other individual.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: direct marketing (直接促銷) has the meaning given by section 35A(1) of the Privacy Ordinance;
health care services (醫護服務) has the same meaning as in sections 35B and 35I of the Privacy Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Secretary may appoint a public officer to be the Commissioner for the Electronic Health Record.
The appointment is to be notified in the Gazette.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner has the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to establish, operate, maintain and develop the System;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to regulate and supervise the sharing and using of data and information contained in the System;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to supervise the compliance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to promote the System to healthcare recipients, healthcare providers and the public;

paragraph.name: e
f
paragraph.content: to advise the Secretary on matters relating to the System;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to devise a mechanism for handling complaints relating to the operation of the System.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may do anything necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of a function of the Commissioner.
The Commissioner may appoint in writing a person to assist the Commissioner in performing a function and exercising a power.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Commissioner to keep register of prescribed healthcare providers

subsection.content: The Commissioner must establish and maintain a register of prescribed healthcare providers for the purposes of this Ordinance.
The register may be kept in a form, and may contain information, that the Commissioner considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The register must be made available for a member of the public to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a healthcare provider is registered as a healthcare provider for the System under section 20(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the service location for which the healthcare provider is registered.

subsection.leadIn: The register must be made available for public inspection free of charge—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: through the Internet; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the office of the Commissioner, or any other Government offices as the Commissioner may direct, during normal office hours.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Commissioner to require production of records or documents in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If it appears to the Commissioner that there are circumstances suggesting the happening of an event specified in subsection (2), the Commissioner may in writing require a prescribed healthcare provider to produce the record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is or may be relevant to the event; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is in the possession or under the control of the healthcare provider.

subsection.leadIn: The event is that—

subparagraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance;
a provision of a code of practice issued under section 52; or
a condition for the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the healthcare provider no longer provides healthcare at the service location to which the registration relates;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the healthcare provider no longer complies with—

subparagraph.content: the requirements specified by the Commissioner for connecting the healthcare provider to the System; or
the system requirements on data sharing specified by the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the service or business nature of the healthcare provider is no longer consistent with the purpose of the use of data and information specified in section 28; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the registration may impair the security or compromise the integrity of the System.

subsection.content: The requirement must specify the manner in which the record or document must be produced.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Commissioner to issue code of practice

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner may issue a code of practice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the manner in which the Commissioner proposes to perform a function or exercise a power; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on the operation of a provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The Commissioner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must publish the code of practice in a manner appropriate to bringing it to the notice of persons affected by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must make copies of the code of practice available to the public (in hard copy or electronic form).

subsection.content: The Commissioner may amend or revoke the code of practice. Subsections (2) and (4) apply to an amendment or revocation of the code of practice in the same way as they apply to the code of practice.
A code of practice issued under this section is not subsidiary legislation.
The Commissioner may specify the form of a document required for the purposes of this Ordinance.
The Commissioner may specify more than one form of the document, whether as alternatives or to provide for different circumstances.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be completed in accordance with the directions and instructions that are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the completed form is required to be provided to the Commissioner or any other person, must be so provided in the manner specified in the form.

subsection.content: A board is established with the name “Electronic Health Record Research Board” in English and “電子健康紀錄研究委員會” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The Board is to consist of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Permanent Secretary for Health, as ex officio member and chairman; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner, or a person nominated by the Commissioner as representative, as ex officio member; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not more than 10 other members appointed by the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A person may be appointed as a non-ex officio member only if the person is, in the Secretary’s opinion, a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having expertise or experience in healthcare, privacy protection, statistics, research, law or information technology;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: representing the interests of healthcare recipients; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: having other experience that would render the person suitable for the appointment.

subsection.content: A non-ex officio member may hold office for a term of not exceeding 5 years and on the terms specified in his or her letter of appointment by the Secretary.
A non-ex officio member is eligible for reappointment on the expiry of a term.
A non-ex officio member may resign from the Board by notice in writing to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may terminate the office of a non-ex officio member if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the member has ceased to be of the capacity because of which he or she was appointed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the member is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member of the Board.

subsection.content: Every appointment or termination under this section is to be notified in the Gazette.
Except as provided in this Ordinance, the Board may regulate its procedure and may make standing orders for that purpose.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: non-ex officio member (非當然委員) means a member of the Board appointed under subsection (2)(c).

section.name: s55
section.heading: Function of Board
section.leadIn: The function of the Board is to make recommendations to the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for deciding whether to approve or refuse an application made under section 32(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for imposing conditions on approving an application made under that section.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Right of appeal—against decisions of Commissioner

subsection.content: A person who is aggrieved by any of the Commissioner’s decisions set out in subsection (2) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board.

subsection.leadIn: The decisions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to refuse to register a healthcare recipient under section 8(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to suspend the registration of a healthcare recipient under section 10(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to cancel the registration of a healthcare recipient under section 11(1);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to refuse to register a healthcare provider as a healthcare provider for the System under section 20(1);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to suspend a registration of a registered healthcare provider under section 24(1); and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to cancel a registration of a registered healthcare provider under section 25(1).

subsection.content: An appeal may only be made within 28 days after the aggrieved person receiving notice of the decision.
An appeal does not suspend the decision unless the Commissioner decides otherwise.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Access to card face data of healthcare recipient

subsection.content: This section applies if the Commissioner or a prescribed healthcare provider gains access to the card face data of the identity card of a healthcare recipient by using facilities provided by or with the approval of the Government.

The Commissioner or the prescribed healthcare provider is to be regarded as having lawful authority to gain access to the card face data of the identity card of the healthcare recipient for the purposes of regulation 12(1A) of the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: card face data (證面數據) means the data specified in paragraph 1(a), (c), (d) and (e) of Schedule 1 to the Registration of Persons Regulations (Cap. 177 sub. leg. A) that are stored in the chip embodied in an identity card.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Limitation of public liability
section.leadIn: The Government or a public officer does not incur any civil liability only because—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: data or information contained in an electronic health record is used in accordance with this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the participation of a healthcare recipient or healthcare provider in the System is subject to the approval by a public officer; or

content.i: the use of data and information contained in an electronic health record referred to in section 29 is subject to the approval of the Secretary or the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom this section applies is not civilly liable for an act done or omitted to be done by the person in good faith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in performing a function or purportedly performing a function under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in exercising a power or purportedly exercising a power under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not affect the liability of the Government for the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an employee of the Hospital Authority, or an employee of a body corporate established by the Hospital Authority under section 5(n) of the Hospital Authority Ordinance (Cap. 113), appointed by the Commissioner under section 49(3).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Service of notice etc.
section.leadIn: A notice or document required to be given or sent under this Ordinance is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, given or sent if—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to and delivered personally to the individual;
it is sent to the individual by post addressed to the individual at the individual’s last known address;
it is sent to the individual by a text message addressed to the individual at the individual’s last known telephone number;
it is addressed to the company and delivered to an officer of the company by hand;
it is addressed to the company and left at or sent by post to the registered office of the company; or
it is sent to the company by post addressed to the company at the company’s last known address;

it is addressed to the partnership and delivered to a place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business, and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership by hand; or
it is sent to the partnership by post addressed to the partnership at the partnership’s last known address; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a statutory body, a body corporate other than a company, or an unincorporated body of persons other than a partnership—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the body and delivered to a place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business, and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the body by hand; or
it is sent to the body by post addressed to the body at the body’s last known address.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule
section.content: The Secretary may by notice published in the Gazette amend the Schedule.

td.p: A registered pharmacist within the meaning of the Pharmacy and Poisons Ordinance (Cap. 138).
A registered dentist within the meaning of the Dentists Registration Ordinance (Cap. 156).
An enrolled dental hygienist within the meaning of the Ancillary Dental Workers (Dental Hygienists) Regulations (Cap. 156 sub. leg. B).
A registered medical practitioner within the meaning of the Medical Registration Ordinance (Cap. 161).
A registered midwife within the meaning of the Midwives Registration Ordinance (Cap. 162).
A registered nurse or enrolled nurse within the meaning of the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164).
A registered medical laboratory technologist within the meaning of the Medical Laboratory Technologists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 359 sub. leg. A).
A registered occupational therapist within the meaning of the Occupational Therapists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulations (Cap. 359 sub. leg. B).
A registered optometrist within the meaning of the Optometrists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 359 sub. leg. F). (Amended 33 of 2025 s. 209)
A registered radiographer within the meaning of the Radiographers (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 359 sub. leg. H).
A registered physiotherapist within the meaning of the Physiotherapists (Registration and Disciplinary Procedure) Regulation (Cap. 359 sub. leg. J).
A registered chiropractor within the meaning of the Chiropractors Registration Ordinance (Cap. 428).
A listed or registered Chinese medicine practitioner within the meaning of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549).
